plugin_name.description: Plugin name (e.g. apps.plugin, proc.plugin, go.d.plugin). It must match the name of the binary in the plugins.d directory.

module_name.description: Module name (e.g. apache, /proc/stat, httpcheck). It usually has the same name as the module configuration file (external plugin) or the section name in netdata.conf (internal plugin).

data_collection.description: An overview of the collected metrics and a detailed description of the data collection method.

metrics_description.description: Brief description of what metrics are collected. A suggested approach here is to talk about the areas covered (e.g. health, performance, errors) and the metric scopes.

method_description.description: Description of how metrics are collected (e.g. HTTP requests, establish a TCP connection and send a command, a specific binary execution). A suggested approach here is to provide a detailed description of how the collector gathers metrics: how many connections are established, exact requests/commands executed, exact endpoints used.

supported_platforms.description: Supported OS/platforms. By default, all platforms supported by Netdata are considered supported. See https://learn.netdata.cloud/docs/installing/platform-support-policy#currently-supported-platforms.

include.description: Only supported OS/platforms. Platforms supported by Netdata will be ignored, only those listed are considered supported.

exclude.description: Unsupported OS/platforms. The result set is all platforms supported by Netdata except for those excluded.

multi-instance.description: Whether this collector supports collecting metrics from multiple (for example, local and remote) instances.

additional_permissions.description: Information about additional permissions other than those required by the Netdata process (e.g. setuid, specific Linux capabilities).

auto_detection.description:
Does this collector support auto-detection?
Example: The collector auto-detects apache web servers running on localhost ports 80, 443, and 8080.

limits.description:
Are there any default limits related to this collector?
Example: The collector is limited on monitoring up to 1000 database tables

performance_impact.description:
Is there any impact on the monitored application?
Example: The collector becomes resource heavy once it monitors more than 10k tables per second.

prerequisites.description:
Provide a list of prerequisites, example:
list:
  - title: Prerequisite for heading
    text: |
      Either explain with text, or use markdown list to list steps

description.description: Description for the prerequisites sub-section, you can use lists or any other markdown-like syntax

file.description: Specify in a text key which file the user has to edit.

description.description: If there is anything specific about this section that needs to be noted mention it here.

list.description: Each of the list's items represents a row in the available config options table

default_value.description: Default value of the option, leave empty if none

required.description: A boolean value indicating if this options is required or not. Use true / false

details.description: If details need to be provided for this option, add them here.

description.description: If needed, provide a description and extra info for the example

configuration_data.description: Add the configuration data in yaml format

jobs.description: An array of configurations as they would appear in the .conf files

problems.description: List of possible problems that appear often for this collector, about external configuration or other matters.

name.description: Give a title for the section.

integrations.description: A list of integrations that can be used to better monitor this module

items.description:
name in format module_name
Example:
list:
  - apache
  - weblog

overview_text.description: The text that will be used for refering to this section from the overview section.

info_provided_to_referring_integrations.description: Some information that this collector can provide about itself when other integrations mention it. This text will not be rendered in this collector's page.

alerts.description: This section is autogenerated, only user validation is to ensure the "os" field is in line with the OS the collector can run on. If this runs on freebsd but the "os" field is "linux", just delete the list item.

metrics.description: Autogenerated section,  user input is needed to provide a description for labels if any, and to add the scope's rendered name in each scope.

rendered_name.description:
Please fill this in, it should fit:
"Metrics per X" and "X Level" where X is the scope name.

_monitored_instance.description: Information about the monitored instance (metrics source).

name.description: Metrics source name (e.g. VerneMQ, Network interfaces, Files and directories). Use official spelling for applications.

link.description: Link to the monitored instance official website if any.

enabled.description: Determines if this content should be folded
